title: language_test1_07
prompt:
What is the best way to complete blank 7?

The deepest part of the trench is called the Challenger Deep, a small valley at the southern end, where ![dropdown:Drop_Down_539_50] the surface of the ocean.
feedback: The correct answer is “the ocean floor is almost seven miles below.” The sentence should read: “The deepest part of the trench is called the Challenger Deep, a small valley at the southern end, where the ocean floor is almost seven miles below the surface of the ocean.” The difference between the answer choices is the placement of the word “almost.” The word "almost" can be an adverb or a adjective. Where it's placed in the sentence shows what "almost" modifies. In this case, "almost" modifies "seven." The word "almost" should be near the word "seven."
